title.narrative: 1.2 PoD Consortium builds capacities

title.narrative: # of consortium partners/partners/country office members trained

description.narrative: # of consortium partners/partners/country office members trained

comment.narrative: for the program goal of PoD to be achieved the capacity of organizations and their staffs need to be to the standard level and as the requirement of their mandates. NIMD has been identifying capacity gaps within its own staff and the staffs of partners. There is a huge capacity need from partners in organizational (such as finance) development and thematic (such as gender) areas.

NIMD staff have not received capacity building trainings in 2021. The planned capacity building activities were not materialized due to the crisis in Ethiopia and coordination issues. However, NIMD provides trainings and capacity building activities to boundary institutions, mainly Caffee Oromia and HoPR on M&E (23), Financial management (26) and legislative drafting (37).
At the end of 2021 NIMD will reach 100 staff members (of NIMD and boundary partners) with capacity building trainings, exposure visits and experience sharing workshops as per identified gaps.

title.narrative: # of political/civic actors taken measures enhancing representation of women and youth

description.narrative: # of political/civic actors taken measures enhancing representation of women and youth

comment.narrative: Current level of representation of youth and women is very low, compare it with the population size of youth and women their representation in party membership and decision is very minimal. Parties need to be supported to take conscious action of attracting women and youth to be their members and skill and exposures/study visits to be facilitated on how parties can enable their youth and women members to be leaders in the party.

NIMD supported the meeting NEBE organized with CSOs and political parties on the need of women and youth political participation in light of the national elections that was held in June and September 2021. 50 people attended the meeting including Board members of NEBE, none of the actor have taken measures so far

NIMD will work to increase the number of parties which will be taking measures of increasing youth and women membership and enable them to be leaders in the party. 47 political parties over the programme period. One capacity building event to encourage parties to attract youth and women in their party membership and leadership will be organised.

title.narrative: 2.2 Y&W leaders lobby and advocate in decision-making spaces
2.2 Y&W leaders lobby and advocate in decision-making spaces

description.narrative: 2.2 Youth and women leaders lobby and advocate in decision-making spaces
2.2 Youth and women leaders lobby and advocate in decision-making spaces

title.narrative: # of women/youth leaders trained

description.narrative: # of women/youth leaders trained

comment.narrative: the current situation of decision-making being influenced by women and youth is very limited because of two reasons. One, because membership of women in political parties is very limited and it is even more limited when it comes to the leadership level involvement of women, thus very minimal influence in decision making. Second, youth in political parties are not yet at the leadership level of most parties thus very limited capacity to influence decision making.

The idea of this intervention is to enable youth and women in political parties to be valuable members of their party and get promotion to the leadership level by providing trainings like EDAC and follow up targeted trainings to boost their knowledge and change their leadership skill and behavior. The activities have happened. But they have been budgeted under the EU (between January and August) and USAID/OTI (between November and December). Although there were more than 100 youth and women trained, none of them were under PoD. As OTI will expire in March, we’ll continue this under PoD in 2022.

POD will enable youth and women in political parties to be valuable members of their party and get promotion to the leadership level by providing trainings like EDAC and follow up targeted trainings to boost their knowledge and change their leadership skill and behavior.

comment.narrative: Diversity within political parties is one gap identified but when it comes for youth and women with diverse background it is a really gap both at national or regional parties.

The current trend does not show that parties having regular discussion agenda regarding inclusion. Thus, NIMD aims to work to ensure that the culture of parties to include youth and women and their needs are regular agenda items in the discussion of the parties. By the end of the programme NIMD hopes to enable political parties to have culture of regular discussion to change policy, policy implementation and to influence design of agenda and policy to be inclusive/show divers’ interests of youth and women and their other needs (disability inclusion, social minority agenda inclusion, etc.). For this year one agreement on the agenda itself was the target. However due to the civil war, the national election and covid issues we were not able to meet this objective.

title.narrative: # of agreements reached (reform agendas / policies / legal amendments)

description.narrative: # of agreements reached (reform agendas / policies / legal amendments)

comment.narrative: NIMD has started dialogue with political parties which led by the joint political party’s council and NEBE, which helped to change the culture of trust (with NEBE, among political parties), coming to the table willing to dialogue, etc. This can serve as a foundation to go to the level of dialogue about grievance on specific topics.

This outcome indicator needs number of preparatory works to reach into agreements on different topics-reform, agenda, policies, etc By the end of the programme, the started dialogue processes will be topic based, iterative and will lead to strong culture of trust among political parties and with NEBE.

comment.narrative: This indicator requires number of preparatory work and 2021 will be the start of the preparatory work

The objective of this outcome is preparatory activities which will pave the way for trust and cooperation among political parties. By the end of the programme NIMD will enable political parities to have good networks, cooperation, trust and mutually benefiting relations with each other’s and with actors which have influence in the political space. The activity here will be supporting JPPC to do workshop with its member political parties on topics of importance as they identify for the strengthening of the structure of JPPC, relationship and trust among political parties. The target for this year was to organize one event and NIMD met the objective by organizing one event on the topic.

comment.narrative: as stated before NIMD has been doing activities that will help trust among political actors by supporting the Ethiopian Joint Political Party Council (EJPPC) which is a foundation to do more in the area of building collaboration among political parties, political parties with DIs and with CSO. These have been done under the previous SP, not yet under the PoD programme.

NIMD has been doing activities that will help trust among political actors by supporting the Ethiopian Joint Political Party Council (EJPPC) which is a foundation to do more in the area of building collaboration among political parties, political parties with DIs and with CSO. As part of that support, NIMD supported and facilitated the general assembly of the JPPC and the annual planning of the activities in collaboration with NEBE

There will be preparatory activities which will pave the way for trust and cooperation among political parties. By the end of the programme NIMD will enable political parities to have good networks, cooperation, trust and mutually benefiting relations with each other’s and with actors which have influence in the political space. comment.narrative: the current institutional capacity of the DIs is not at the level of reaching to the citizens level to encourage citizen direct participation in the democratic space. Moreover, at the regional level the oversight and control capacity of the legislative is not comparable with the muscles of the executive body.

In the inception phase of POD there were discussions and planning started with the three DIs which we are supporting at institutional level to be increased to five by the end of the year. The idea was to include at least one more regional legislature and one additional democratic institution (DI). Nonetheless, due to the security situation, the state of emergency and other administrative matters, this target has not materialized.

In the inception phase of POD there are discussions and planning started with the three DIs which will be increased to five by the end of the year. DIs will have improved relation with citizens and citizens will be encouraged to participate in the democratic space through MP citizen relation, conscious actions designed to involve citizens and their associations to participate in the democratic space

NIMD training for HoPR on legal drafting manual has been attended by 37 experts drawn from HoPR, PM office and attorney general office. In addition to that NIMD supported the induction of the newly appointed MPs by covering expenses of 4 experts with immense expertise on constituency engagement, legal drafting and communications skill. On top of that, NIMD supported the national house in providing expert support on oversight procedure manual
